Content:
you do realize the definition of larceny?
```larceny
noun [ C or U ]   LAW specialized UK 
 / ˈLɑː.s ə n.i / US  / ˈLɑːr.s ə n.i /
 
stealing , especially (in the US) the crime of taking something that does not belong to you, without illegally entering a building to do so```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @richardt what you are not understanding is that he was a capable android person, and did a lot of good work up to a point. He just chose to steal those devices because he was not happy with his pay. So your description isn't quite right. More like "trusted a capable employee and they ended up stealing from you". It's a much different situation that every biz/operation must deal with

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: This was not social engineering. This was a contractor doing contract work on devices, going rogue, stealing the current devices they had access to. I can see why people might be confused, I did not explain it well.
